answerText: stomach[10] After material leaves the stomach, this hormone is released from I-cells in the duodenum. This hormone stimulates the release of bile and digestive enzymes from the gallbladder and pancreas.
heading: Penn-ance |2012 | 13 - Finals 1 | 8 | Science | Biology | College
subject: Science
question: Question: This organ takes on a "watermelon" appearance and bleeds in some patients with scleroderma, and the wall of this organ contains folds called rugae. For 10 points each: [10] Name this organ that is commonly infected by Helicobacter pylori. Parietal cells in this organ secrete hydrochloric acid, while chief cells secrete pepsinogen.
